item.title: Graduate Intern Program - Perception
item.description:
Description

Position:  Graduate Intern Program - Perception
Location:  Kitchener, Ontario (Hybrid) 
Job Type:  Internship
Education: Graduate (Masters or PhD) 
Area of study: Relevant Field of Robotics, Computer Vision, or Machine Learning
Division: OTTO Motors

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)

OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

Clearpath\'s OTTO Motors robots lead the industry in self-driving materials handling, and you can help us push robotics to the next level of intelligence and performance. This means continually learning, inventing, and implementing new algorithms, all with an emphasis on robust and reliable best practice programming. We\'re looking for people excited to develop the next generation of perception algorithms to tackle the toughest challenges in localization and mapping, machine learning, computer vision and more.


The perception team’s primary responsibility is the development of the core robotics software responsible for environmental perception and understanding on all of our vehicles. As a Graduate Research Intern you will work on the testing and development of core robotics software responsible for environmental perception and understanding on all our vehicles. You will be responsible for evaluating state-of-the-art ideas from academia and industry, and taking these ideas out of the lab and into the real world, identifying opportunities to improve, and developing high-performance software to run in real time on the robots.

Your primary responsibilities will be:

  • Create robust innovative solutions to the problems of robotic perception
  • Development of custom SLAM, computer vision, machine learning, target tracking and perception algorithms
  • Evaluation of new perception algorithms and sensing technology
  • Design and implement new perception systems and algorithms
  • Develop integration and unit tests for perception features
  • Supporting deployment and testing of robotic systems

Additional tasks may include:

  • Collaboration with internal teams including the Simulation Team and Navigation Team
  • Triage and support of live industrial systems in the field

Required Skills:

  • Practical and theoretical knowledge in at least one or more areas of: state estimation, computer vision, SLAM, machine learning, target detection and tracking, robotic perception
  • Proficient software development skills in modern C++
  • Proficiency with Linux
  • Excellent teamwork/communication skills
  • Ability to independently develop high quality software solutions

Bonus points for:

  • Hands-on experience with real autonomous systems
  • Experience writing efficient, high performance code
  • ROS, TensorFlow, Gazebo, OpenCV and/or PCL experience
  • Familiarity with graph optimization techniques and libraries
  • Experience with git or other DVCS systems and other software development processes
  • Understanding of sensor error modeling, particularly laser rangefinders and vision systems

 At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Hardware Designer
item.description:
Description

Position:       Hardware Designer

Location:      Waterloo, Ontario             

Experience:     3+ Years relevant experience

Education:    Degree/Diploma in Electrical Engineering or Equivalent Experience

Division:       Clearpath Robotics

 

About Clearpath Robotics Inc.

Clearpath Robotics’ research solutions group is a global leader in unmanned vehicle robotics for research and development, and provides hardware, software, and services to enable self-driving vehicle development, deployment, and operation. Clearpath Robotics works with over 500 of the world’s most innovative brands in over 40 countries, serving markets that span mining, military, agriculture, aerospace, and academia. Visit Clearpath Robotics at www.clearpathrobotics.com.


About the Job

We’re shipping more and more robots and seeing new uses for our products emerge every day!  We need an Embedded Electronics Design Engineer to help us take our innovative designs from napkin sketches to hundreds of pounds of precisely moving parts and facilitate every step in between. You will be responsible for the electronics designs of existing and new research industrial robotics products.  This will range through the entire design process from initial concept design and cost forecasting through to detailed design, validation, and final release to production.  Design challenges will span from high-level system architecture and power distribution to board layout and field testing.

 

Our hardware must be many things, but reliability is paramount. It will be your job to build systems that can operate in whatever environment we subject them to, all while keeping the motors turning for our mechanical team and the 1’s and 0’s flowing properly for our software developers. 

 

Your primary responsibilities will be:

  • Leading electronics design in standard products and custom development projects with a cross-functional team while ensuring that the project is on time and within budget
  • Developing circuits, layouts, and qualification plans for multi-layer PCB designs
  • Specifying and sourcing new board-level and system components, communicating with suppliers as needed
  • Performing system level electrical integration and testing in robotics platforms, including cable assembly design and prototyping
  • Debugging electronics within complex mobile robots and manipulation systems, then driving design revisions to resolve issues
  • Working with manufacturing personnel and vendors to create PCB stack-ups and bill of materials
  • Supporting the electrical systems of standard products of various lifecycle stages 

 

Additional tasks may include:

  • Designing power distribution, battery implementation and motor systems
  • Designing and building cable harnesses, busbars, developing cable management strategies, testing integrated systems, and working in close collaboration with Mechanical Designers and Software Developers
  • Collaborating with our Client Success team to support our customers
  • Supporting the evaluation of existing and new suppliers
  • Participating in certification and compliance reviews
  • Mentoring junior staff, technicians and co-op students
  • Evaluating how we can apply lessons-learned from other industries to our designs
  • Supporting on-site installation and commissioning of robotics equipment at customer facilities; occasional travel may be required (after COVID)

 

About You

You want to work for a small company that thinks big and dreams huge.  You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied with a project left half-done.  You want to be surrounded by people like you; creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work. You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems. Oh, and you have some form of higher education with the common sense to back it up.

 

Required Experience/Skills:

  • Electronics and system level hardware design, including PCB designs involving embedded processors or microcontrollers (preferably STM32)
  • Schematic capture, layout, component libraries development, and bill of material creation using an ECAD tool, preferably Altium Designer
  • Knowledge of communications architectures including ethernet, USB, CAN bus, RS422/485 and I2C
  • Electronic component selection and validation
  • Cable assembly design
  • Debugging of electronics and system level issues using modern lab equipment including high speed oscilloscopes, bus analyzers, logic analyzers, etc.
  • Excellent technical documentation skills
  • Accepting responsibility for your designs in the complete lifecycle from concept to customer
  • Getting your hands dirty and working with your designs: soldering, building cables, building prototype systems, field testing, etc
  • Excellent organizational skills

 

Bonus points for:

  • Working with interdisciplinary teams to optimize product designs
  • Experience with high layer count board designs
  • Strong knowledge of EMC management principles and best practice design for EMI control, in-depth knowledge of PCB design and PCB technology
  • Knowledge about electronics manufacturing and DFM best practices
  • Experience working with high-power battery systems
  • Mechanical / electro-mechanical design experience or aptitude
  • Motor controller design and implementation experience
  • Power electronics and SMPS design experience
  • Experience with sensor selection and integration (proximity, LIDAR, cameras, etc)
  • Experience with Altium and Solidworks
  • Robotics interest or experience
  • Industrial safety system design and FMEA 
  • Standards and/or certification authority experience (UL, CSA, CE, FCC, ESA and NEC)

 

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Intermediate Program Manager
item.description:
Description

Position:                Intermediate Program Manager           
Location:               Kitchener, ON                          
Job Type:              Full-Time Permanent
Experience:          3+ years’ experience       
Education:            Bachelor\'s
Division:               OTTO Motors

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)

OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

We are building a robotics platform. We are growing and need to add a new program manager to manage both our internal teams and external relationships with key partners.

As a Program Manager, you will be responsible for overseeing and coordinating program deliverables and serving as the point of contact between partners and other departments. Your goal is to manage the efforts of team members to ensure our programs are delivered on time and that our partners’ needs are met.

Your Primary Responsibilities will be:

  • Generate and manage the Joint Program Plan from kickoff to product release
  • Scheduling, Task Decomposition, and Resource Management
  • Analyze, evaluate, and mitigate program risks, and produce reports for management and stakeholders
  • Actively manage and expedite critical path tasks
  • Create and maintain a program schedule
  • Work with technical leads to identify:
    • Tasks and Dependencies
    • Resources Requirements (Personnel, Equipment, etc.)
  • Integrate with Software, Hardware and OEM Development Programs
  • Work with the other program managers to identify risks and opportunities across multiple programs
  • Identify key requirements needed from cross-functional team, external vendors and partners
  • Track Program/Product Requirements and Specifications
  • Ensure completion of requirements implementation and verification
  • Working with external partners to ensure program success.  Establish and maintain:
    • Joint schedule
    • Joint risk management activities
    • Communication channels with all stakeholders
    • Action logs and tracking actions to completion
  • Risk Assessment and Management
    • Maintain a Risk Register
  • Managerial
    • Issue Escalation
    • Mentorship
    • Conflict Resolution
    • Relationship Management    

Required Technical Skills

  • Project Management Software
    • Gantt Charts (i.e. MS Project)
    • Task and Issue Tracking (i.e. JIRA)
    • Configuration Control
    • Requirements and Specifications tracking
  • Documentation
    • Solid writing skills
    • Good with spreadsheets to communicate complicated status
    • Executive presentations through effective slides
    • Documentation
  • 3 years of project or program management experience from previous work placements (co-ops included)
  • Conflict resolution and people interface skills
  • Experience with direct customer contact

As our next Program Manager, you know how to under promise and over deliver, adapt to changing directions, priorities and personalities, and multiple stakeholders.  You have program management experience from previous work placements. Bonus points for managing engineering related programs with external partners. 

Bonus Points For

  • Mechatronics background
  • Experience in managing partners
  • 1-2 years of engineering design experience from previous work placements
  • The ability to write macros or scripts with Office programs, JIRA or data processing.

At OTTO Motors, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility. We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression. If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Manager, Development Operations (DevOps)
item.description:
Description

Position:          Manager, Development Operations
Location:        Kitchener, Ontario             
Job Type:       Full-Time Permanent
Experience:     8 to 12 years
Education:      Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering or relevant work experience
Division:         OTTO Motors

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)

OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

The DevOps Team is in need of an experienced manager to help drive and maintain the continuous integration experience.  The team is tasked with ensuring that the full lifecycle of development from source submission to release is fully automated.  The team handles all aspects of the development environment and workflow; build, automated testing platforms, deployment and a full simulation stack.  We develop testing platforms so that other teams can be empowered to write automated tests.  Your day will be split between managerial and supporting development tasks.

Primary responsibilities include:

  • Identify areas of improvement within the CI processes.
  • Delegate, schedule and manage tasks within the DevOps Domain (Sprint and Long-term).
  • Lead and grow a team of highly skilled developers.
  • Collaborate with other teams to determine needs and gaps.
  • Be an ambassador for quality initiatives to ensure that all teams are producing a high-quality product.  
  • Maintain and develop DevOps toolchains and automated processes.

About You

You want to work for a fast-moving company that thinks big and dreams huge. You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied with a project left half-done. You want to be surrounded by people like you; creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work. You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems. 

Required skills and experience:

  • Minimum 3 Years of experience managing a technical team.
  • Minimum 5 Years experience with DevOps/Continuous Integration processes.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Experience working with Linux/Ubuntu based environments.
  • Working in a collaborative virtual environment, interfacing with other team members regularly, sharing knowledge via diagram, discussion, and example.
  • Python Programming or other relevant scripting language.
  • Docker, Kubernetes, VMware or other container or virtualization products
  • Maintaining and developing a job management system (Jenkins, groovy).
  • Source Control software (Git) and knowledge of best practices
  • Experience automating workflows or providing devOps toolchains.
  • Experience developing and administering solutions with AWS tools/technologies

Bonus skills:

  • Experience with test infrastructure or automated test frameworks.
  • Experience working in the robotics industry or knowledge of ROS.
  • Experience working with simulation tool chains (Gazebo)
  • Experience with cloud providers beyond AWS
  • Experience with python and debian packaging 

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Senior Simulation Developer
item.description:
Description

Position:         Senior Simulation Developer          
Location:         Kitchener, Ontario             
Job Type:        Full-Time Permanent
Experience:    2 - 5 years of relevant work experience
Education:      Degree in a related field
Division:          OTTO Motors

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)

OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

The OTTO Motors division of Clearpath is looking for a Simulation Developer to work in the Fleet Software Group.

The Fleet Software Group is responsible for the design, development and support of the Fleet Manager and software applications that allow our users to interact with, monitor and support their fleets of OTTO Autonomous Vehicles. This involves participation in the entire product workflow, from customer insight gathering, problem definition, solution proposals, application design, development and support.

For this role we are seeking an individual to develop & maintain software tools and assets used in our simulation stack. You will be working closely with other members of the DevOps, Vehicle Systems, Fleet software development teams as well as many other groups within OTTO Motors, in order to provide robust and easy-to-use solutions to the problems our employees & customers need to solve with their simulation environments and workflows.

About You

For the role of Simulation Developer we are seeking an experienced developer to support, maintain, and extend robotic simulations in a full-stack simulation environment in a small team.  Your work will directly support a variety of internal groups in testing, developing and training.

Responsibilities:

  • Designing and developing new simulation tools and assets.
  • Maintaining and extending existing simulation automation/deployment tools and assets.
  • Improving useability and robustness of our simulation tool set.
  • Writing internal documentation for new and existing simulation tools and assets.
  • Troubleshooting simulation automation/deployment issues and bugs.
  • Supporting development operations, internal tools, and infrastructure.
  • Supporting development systems infrastructure.

 Additional responsibilities may include:

  • Developing, maintaining, and extending simulation plugins, both internal and upstream.
  • Alerting the team and stopping the robots from starting their own revolution.

Skills and experience:

  • Minimum 2-5 years of experience in software development in an enterprise environment.
  • Object-oriented programming experience (C++).
  • Working with Linux/Ubuntu based environments and scripting (Bash, Python 3.5+).
  • Use of emplating formats and markup languages (e.g. XML, YAML, JSON).
  • Using continuous integration (Jenkins/GitLab pipelines) and source control (Git).
  • Diagnosing and narrowing down the source of issues.
  • Working in a collaborative virtual environment, interfacing with other team members regularly, sharing knowledge via diagram, discussion, and example.
  • Creating/maintaining virtual models & environments in a physics based simulator.

Bonus Points For:

  • Other object-oriented programming experience (e.g. C#, Java)
  • Experience with ROS / Robotics Systems.
  • Experience with Gazebo/Unity/Unreal/Isaac simulation.
  • Experience in 3D graphics software and programming.
  • Experience with containers and Kubernetes
  • Familiarity with Nix

Clearpath is committed to supporting a culture of diversity and accessibility across the organization.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, sex, gender identity/expression, veteran status or sexual orientation. If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Electrical Development Team Lead
item.description:
Description

Position:           Electrical Development Team Lead
Location:          Kitchener, ON
Job Type:          Full-Time Permanent
Experience:     5+ years relevant work experience
Education:       Degree in a related field or equivalent work experience
Division:           OTTO Motors

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)

OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

You will guide and manage the Electrical Development Engineering team by providing tactical day-to-day guidance and direction; establishing team strategy (objectives, metrics, priorities, and best practices); enabling the team to perform at their best, as well as applying your technical expertise to solve complex problems.  In addition, you will be responsible for significant portions of the electrical system design and implementation for our new and existing products.

The Electrical Development team works closely with our hardware, software, and new product development teams to establish sustainable development and support of our products, providing a robust design to our customers.

In addition, the team will adhere to safety standards and processes such as ISO13849, ISO12100, IEC61508, R15.08, and IEC 3691-4 or similar standards applicable to mobile robots.

Furthermore, the team is a contributor to defining our product requirements and is an influencer of our product roadmap.

Your responsibilities will include:

  • Delegate, schedule, and manage tasks within the Electrical Development Team’s domain
  • Providing performance and development feedback
  • Ensuring consistent quality of service and deliverables from the Electrical Development group
  • Working with and improving our existing processes for Electrical design and development on our products
  • Adapting and improving the overall service and performance
  • Develop working relationships with vendors to help ensure OTTO motors is selecting the highest quality and latest technology parts in our products
  • Lead some technical projects yourself
  • Industrial control system design and architecture with an eye to ISO 13849, ANSI B56.5, IEC 61508 and others as needed.
  • Support high-level vehicle architecture design
  • First level of triage for electrical issues
  • Verifying basic robot functionality (ROS skills as needed)
  • Prototype assembly (Build parts of the robot as needed) 
  • Design Documentation (Meeting minutes, requirements definition, architecture documents, controls analysis, CAD, PLM, internal troubleshooting, assembly and installation documentation)
  • Write and execute good validation and test  plans for new vehicle technologies that make clear and actionable conclusions
  • Be knowledgeable in the robot product lifecycle, and bring-in feedback from all relevant parties at the right time.

Required skills:

  • Degree in engineering, computer science, robotics, or a related field with applicable background
  • 1-2+ years’ experience in a management role in an engineering environment 
  • 5+ years of experience in electrical engineering roles
  • Effective decision making
  • Strong communicator
  • Project and resource management experience
  • Technical acuity (e.g., ideas contributor to implementation strategies, product features and requirements)
  • Ability to work with minimal supervision and manage deadlines.
  • Experience with hands-on prototyping and troubleshooting of electromechanical systems
  • Able to understand and communicate concepts readily via sketches, block diagrams, flow charts, and technical writing
  • Able to work in Canada

Bonus Points for:

  • Experience working with industrial robots.
  • Experience in designing to comply with the European, US and Canadian standards, particularly FCC and CE or liaising with NRTLs
  • Experience with design for functional safety (ISO 12100, EN 61508, etc.)
  • Knowledge of WHMA/IPC-A-620
  • Experience with C Language software solutions on embedded platforms e.g. C++ and Python
  • Experience with the V-model or other similar verification and validation methodologies 
  • Working knowledge of aspects of mobile robotics such as perception, planning, controls, and navigation
  • Power distribution and motor systems
  • Low speed digital/analog circuit design
  • Cable assembly design
  • PCBA design, microprocessor and network integration (CAN, Ethernet, ModBUS etc.)
  • Familiarity with industrial material handling vehicles
  • Experience with ROS
  • Past hands-on experience with mobile robots, industrial trucks, or AGCs as an operator or developer

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility. We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression. If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Quality Analyst
item.description:
Description

Position:          Quality Analyst
Location:          Kitchener, Ontario         
Job Type:          Full-Time Permanent
Experience:      2+ yrs relevant work experience
Education:        Diploma/Degree in a related field 
Division:           OTTO Motors

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)

OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

We are currently selling more robots than we can build! We require an organized individual to assist with inspection of a variety of made to spec. components, to assist with analysis on issued MTS/OTS parts and to communicate solutions to all vested parties. We need a Quality Analyst to take responsibility in ensuring our core products are built with components of the utmost quality as well as ensuring our core products are capable of handling specified end-user requirements. You will be a part of our Quality team helping us make sure that Clearpath robots can handle the world’s dullest, dirtiest and deadliest jobs for many years.

Your primary responsibilities will be:

  • Incoming quality inspection of made to spec harnesses and printed circuit board assemblies
  • Testing, troubleshooting of Electrical Harnesses, PCBAs, Electrical Bays/Panels, etc.
  • In process and finished goods quality validation
  • Assist in the creation of NCR’s and document issues learned from your diagnosis
  • Process/Traceability documentation

Additional tasks may include:

  • Assisting mechanical inspections, assembly inspections, as needed
  • Process implementation and refinement
  • Participating in Continuous Improvement and 5S activities
  • All other duties as assigned

About You

You want to work for a small company that thinks big and dreams huge.  You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied doing a job less than 100%. You want to be surrounded by people like you; creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work.  You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems. Oh, and you have some form of higher education with the common sense to back it up.

Required Technical Skills:

  • Ability to read a schematic, identify mechanical/electrical components and determine root cause of PCB or robot test failures
  • Practical understanding of mechanical/electrical defects
  • Practical understanding of cable assembly, PCBA quality standards and common defects
  • Knowledge of Microsoft Office Excel and Word, Google Sheets and Docs.

Bonus points for:

  • Any of IPC-7711, IPC-7721, IPC-A-600, IPC-9121, IPC-610, IPC-620 training or equivalent
  • Familiarity with Linux
  • Familiarity with ISO standards
  • Lean manufacturing experience
  • 5S methodology

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Robot Builder
item.description:
Description

About Clearpath Robotics Inc.

Clearpath Robotics Inc. develops the future of robotics technology through development and sale of industry-leading self-driving technology, products, and services to over 500 of the world’s most innovative brands. Proprietary hardware, software, and services are delivered through the company’s research and industrial divisions: Clearpath Robotics and OTTO™ Motors. Clearpath Robotics Inc. is an award-winning company with recent awards including Robotics Business Review Top 50 Robotics Company, Edison Award for Innovation, Business Insider Top 40 under 40, and Canada’s Top 100 Employers.

About the Job:

We are currently selling more robots than we can build! We require a handy individual to take charge of assembling a variety of different platforms and ensuring that we perpetually strive for a higher level of quality. We need a Robot Builder to take responsibility in assembling our core products along with their accessories.

You will contribute to a team dedicated to seeing a robotic platform from start to finish. Additionally, when you are not wrenchin’ down screws, you will be tasked with maintaining the organization and cleanliness of the production area.

This position requires the worker to be on site for the full daily shift. There is no opportunity to work from home. 

Your primary responsibilities will be:

  • Electromechanical Assembly of robotic platforms 
    • Use of hand tools
    • Use of hoisting equipment
    • Cable installation and wire routing
  • Rotating throughout different assembly stations to achieve cross-training among team members
  • Ensuring your workspace follows 5S guidelines
  • Using a computer for work instructions via VKS system
  • Production area maintenance
  • Production equipment maintenance
  • Other duties as assigned

About You:

You want to work for a small company that thinks big and dreams huge.  You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied doing a job less than 100%.  You want to be surrounded by people like you; creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work.  You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems.  

Required Skills:

  • Experience working on manual product assembly
  • Wiring or cable installation experience preferred
  • Hands-on experience with common tools, eg, screwdriver, hammer, and electric drills.
  • Practical knowledge of Microsoft Office Excel and GSuite
  • Able to work the Day shift Hours 7am - 3pm Monday to Friday
  • Positive and professional attitude with safety mindset
  • Proven ability to work independently
  • Experience working with ERP systems is an asset.
  • Ability to follow written assembly work instructions in English
  • Comfortable with abrupt changes to project deadlines.
  • Ability to lift up to 50 lbs comfortably 

Bonus points for:

  • Hobbies that involve working with power tools, woodworking for instance
  • Hobbies that involve assembly with hand tools, car maintenance for instance
  • Lean manufacturing experience
  • Continuous Improvement Process
  • 5S methodology
  • Previously being part of a Health & Safety Committee

What’s in it for you:

  • Work life balance - vacation, flexible long weekends, half-day birthdays and wellness days
  • Competitive salary and career growth opportunities
  • Comprehensive benefits for you and your family to support your health and wellness
  • Corporate discounts and Group Insurance (home and auto)
  • Free snacks to keep you energized during the shift!
  • Cool company events such as BBQs and other celebrations including occasional food trucks at the facilities
  • Growth opportunities 
  • Friendly and fun co-workers!

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility. We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression. If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Partner Marketing Manager
item.description:
Description

Position: Partner Marketing Manager               
Location: Kitchener, Ontario             
Job Type: Full-Time Permanent
Experience: 5+ Years Relevant Work Experience
Education: Graduate Degree in Related Field
Division: OTTO Motors


About OTTO Motors, a division of Clearpath Robotics

At OTTO Motors, we believe material handling is one of the most dangerous and unproductive parts of modern industrial operations. Our mission is to create safer, more productive and fulfilling workplaces with autonomous material handling technology. Most recently, OTTO Motors was recognized among the top 1% of Canada’s highest-performing global private companies by Communitech. Our loyal customers are also the most recognizable brands in the world and trust OTTO Motors to fulfill their mission-critical material handling needs: General Electric, Toyota, Hershey, Caterpillar, Berry Global, and more. For more information about us, visit www.ottomotors.com.


About the Job:

The global market for mobile robotics is expected to exceed $224 billion by 2030, according to global technology market advisory firm ABI Research. OTTO Motors is at the center of this enormous market growth fuelled by labor shortages, pressure to compete internationally and the modernization of manufacturing facilities. The Channel Sales and Enablement team is a strategic sales organization that is responsible for building, selling and supporting our vastly growing partner and dealer network who are on a mission to deploy autonomous mobile robots in manufacturing facilities and warehouses around the world.

As a Partner Marketing Manager, we are looking for you to bring your unmatched work ethic, collaboration, enthusiasm and your strong passion for the customer to cultivate profound growth within our partner and dealer network. In this role, you will lead OTTO Motors’ channel marketing efforts and demand generation strategies to grow the brand and revenue for both the partner and OTTO Motors. This role requires having an understanding of best-in-class marketing practices, relationship building skill sets, and experience in implementing joint strategies that will empower our partners to bring market-defining solutions to customers. This opportunity will allow you to accelerate your career growth as you work closely with highly complex partner organizations, build strong relationships in the C-Suite and collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders. OTTO Motors is proud to provide all employees flexibility in that you can work from home.

 

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Build and maintain trusted relationships with partners and align their goals and strategies with OTTO Motors’ to create joint marketing initiatives that will expand global market share and achieve channel pipeline targets
  • Design and execute a mix of marketing campaigns that are proven to achieve the business objectives that the partner and OTTO Motors team identified
  • Monitor results, drive pipeline reviews and coach partners to continuously address campaign challenges in order to achieve partner sales goals
  • Advocate for the partner internally to help prioritize the partners’ marketing-related goals while also acting as the partners’ main marketing point of contact 
  • Work very closely with the Channel Sales and Enablement Team and your colleagues on the marketing team to leverage and expand marketing activities within the channel

 

The ideal candidate will have:

  • Proven channel marketing experience in tech, OEM or dealer organization
  • Experience working in fast-paced, rapidly changing environment and has the ability to clearly define, diagnose and execute an appropriate solution
  • Relationship management experience and skill sets to interact confidently with senior leaders of partner organizations
  • Proven experience building and executing launch plans and demand generation programs, including: email, video, webinar, event, lunch and learns and digital programs
  • Data driven mindset and has ability to manage pipeline targets, track lead progression in the funnel and ensure strategy alignment with business priorities
  • Excellent ability to communicate marketing messages and technical concepts through various mediums
  • BA/BS in marketing, business or related fields preferred

At OTTO Motors, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility. We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression. If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Product Manager
item.description:
Description

Position:             Product Manager
Location:            Kitchener, ON
Job Type:            Full-Time Permanent
Experience:        3 Years of relevant work experience
Education:         Bachelors Degree
Division:             OTTO Motors

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)

OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com. 

About the Opportunity:

We are looking for a product manager to add to our growing team. We need someone with a track record of success bringing great products to market. An ideal candidate has experience bringing enterprise-grade software to market, comes from an automation background or really understands the industrial automation, manufacturing, or distribution space.

 

You will be responsible for a critical part of our portfolio in material movement and your experience in product management will help you drive the products’ success. You will work closely with the rest of the OTTO product development team to make sure that we are delivering properly engineered solutions. You will work closely with both sales and marketing to ensure your products are competitive, valuable and understood in the marketplace.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Contribute to product strategy, vision, and execution of our software to ensure the health, well-being and happiness of our robots.
  • Build a detailed near- and long-term product roadmap. Validate with key customers and stakeholders.
  • Translate software requirements into product deliverables and drive them to completion
  • Work closely with the engineering team to deliver great software solutions
  • Act as a product evangelist internally and externally champion the best in class material movement platform
  • Be the expert on the competition and how to beat them.

Required Experience/Skills:

Product Managers come from various backgrounds, therefore, most importantly we are looking for someone who matches the description above and is looking to take on the world. That being said we consider these baselines for our next team member:

  • You have been building software products for a while and have 3 years’ experience shipping products as a product manager
  • You have a degree or diploma in Business or Engineering related fields
  • You have worked with engineering teams as a product owner and have demonstrable experience leading cross-functional teams to define, execute and iterate on projects
  • You are adept at both verbal and visual communication and can lead teams through difficult decisions.
  • You have a demonstrable track record shipping high-quality product, and can excel in product design when required
  • You can break down strategy into tactics and tactics into metrics

What’s in it for you:

  • Meaningfully contribute to a compelling vision
  • Work-life balance (flexible hours)
  • Competitive compensation
  • Health benefits
  • Career development
  • Equity

Description

Experience:      2+ yrs relevant work experience
Education:        Diploma/Degree in a related field

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)

OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

We are currently selling more robots than we can build! We require an organized individual to assist with inspection of a variety of made to spec. components, to assist with analysis on issued MTS/OTS parts and to communicate solutions to all vested parties. We need a Quality Analyst to take responsibility in ensuring our core products are built with components of the utmost quality as well as ensuring our core products are capable of handling specified end-user requirements. You will be a part of our Quality team helping us make sure that Clearpath robots can handle the world’s dullest, dirtiest and deadliest jobs for many years.

Your primary responsibilities will be:

  • Complete Incoming Quality Inspection of made to spec mechanical parts and assemblies
  • Review, audit and complete First Article Inspection Reports
  • Troubleshoot lineside mechanical problems
  • Assist in the creation of NCRs and document issues learned from your diagnosis
  • Process/Traceability documentation

Additional tasks may include:

  • Assist with quality inspection of made to spec harness assemblies
  • Liaising with engineers to provide input on design improvements
  • Process implementation and refinement
  • Participating in Continuous Improvement and 5S activities
  • All other duties as assigned

About You

You want to work for a small company that thinks big and dreams huge.  You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied doing a job less than 100%. You want to be surrounded by people like you; creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work.  You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems. Oh, and you have some form of higher education with the common sense to back it up.

Required Technical Skills:

  • Ability to read mechanical drawings
  • Practical understanding of mechanical/electrical defects
  • Knowledgeable of GD&T
  • Practical understanding of manufacturing processes, standards and common defects
  • Knowledge of Microsoft Office Excel and Word,Google Suite

Bonus points for:

  • Familiarity with Linux

item.title: Systems Integrator
item.description:
Description

Position:             Systems Integrator    
Location:             Kitchener, ON     
Job Type:            Full-Time Permanent
Experience:        3+ years of relevant work experience (IC3 Intermediate)
Education:          Electrical/Mechanical/Industrial Controls/Mechatronics/Systems Engineering related field
Division:              OTTO Motors

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)

OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

The Systems Engineering (SE) team works closely with our Project Management Office (PMO) within our professional services organization to deliver business value to our end users, channel partners, and for OTTO Motors.  SEs design and implement fleets of OTTO autonomous mobile robots (AMR) and software at our customer facilities. In addition, the SE team delivers training to our integration partners and end-users, and evaluates use cases to establish guidelines, standards, and best practices for how OTTO Motors products can be used by the market, specifically by our integrator network. Furthermore, the SE team is a major contributor to defining our product requirements and is a major influencer of our product roadmap.

Primary responsibilities:

  • detailed design of AMR systems using OTTO Motors products to meet the customer requirements; this includes workflow design, attachment design, map design and development/modification middle layer software logic using Ignition OPC/UA and/or PLC logic design and modification
  • authoring & executing acceptance test plans for validation of system functionality and performance;
  • commissioning & integration of AMR systems at client facilities throughout the world; this includes traveling to customer or integration partner facility for on-site deployment and integration with facility side automation equipment
  • optimizing system performance through analysis, simulation, and experimentation;
  • project planning for the deliverables and work packages you own;
  • communicating technical details and status to the customer and broader project team;
  • consulting with integration partners on all of the above
  • delivery of training to integration partners as well as end users
  • troubleshooting software & hardware technical issues using internal tools available; solving new and challenging technical problems related to the above

Additional responsibilities:

  • authoring new product requirements based on the lessons learned from your design and commissioning activities;
  • working with the systems engineering team to improve department tools, processes, and working relationships with other departments;
  • ability to travel for business within North America, Europe and Asia; ~35 - 45 % travel commitment over the year (travel mostly contained to Canada and USA).  Trips to site would typically be 2 weeks on - 2 weeks off during the project integration phase.

About You

You want to work for a fast-moving company that thinks big and dreams huge. You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied with a project left half-done. You want to be surrounded by people who are creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work. You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems.  You have a customer-first mentality and strive to exceed customer expectations.

Your mastery comes from years of experience in designing and integrating complex systems solutions for industrial automation applications. You are able to represent a complex system via a simplified block diagram representation to convey the objective and details to the end-user systematically.

Required background:

  • 3+ years of relevant work experience
  • 3+ years of experience commissioning & integrating industrial automated equipment or software that interfaces to the equipment
  • college/university diploma or degree in an engineering, design, or industrial controls type of field
  • experience working directly with clients/end-users
  • experience in troubleshooting and repairing electro-mechanical systems/subsystems
  • interpretation & design analysis of mechanical drawings and electrical schematics
  • PLC design and integration experience
  • demonstrated ability to work with Linux
  • planning and organization (how to approach and solve a problem, work breakdown to achieve the end goal, etc.)
  • strong communicator, verbal and written
  • self-motivated and organized with a keen eye for detail

Bonus for experience:

  • training users of automated equipment/software
  • authoring and modifying software code (python, C++, or other)
  • experience with inductive Automation Ignition OPC/UA software
  • Have Spanish as first, second or third language.

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Training Content Designer/Developer (Technical)
item.description:
Description

Position at Clearpath Inc.

Position:       Training Content Designer/Developer (Technical)
Location:      Kitchener, ON
Job Type:     Full-Time Permanent
Experience:   3+ years
Education:    CPA, BBA or MAcc
Division:       OTTO Motors

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)

OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

The integrator enablement team at OTTO Motors is accountable for creating training content, designing training delivery programs, and for administering the delivery of training for the OTTO Motors’ dealers and systems integrator (SI) network.  The SI network consists of SI partners and self-integrating end-user clients. The deliverables and services provided by this group are essential for the day-to-day operations of the business as well as to the growth of the business as it expands the SI partner network. It also helps the business stay ahead of a market trend of more clients wanting to self-integrate autonomous mobile robots (AMRs) into their operations.

This team also plays a role in improving our product by advising on product features and the product roadmap to simplify the user experience and amount of time and effort involved with designing, deploying, and integrating OTTO Motors products. 

As the Training Content Designer/Developer, you will take on the following responsibilities and roles. 

  • be a creative contributor to the development and design of our e-learning and in-class content;
  • create storyboards and detailed scripts for videos, labs, and qualification exercises;
  • assist in configuring and administering a learning management system (LMS);
  • configure simulation environments used in the labs;
  • administer the training content library(ies) and database;
  • facilitate contributions from our subject matter expert (SME) and content production networks; and,
  • participate in the production of videos and other content (e.g. be the voice and hands in the videos)
  • You will also need to understand the technology of OTTO Motors products at a depth that allows you to design training material that explains the theory and principles of our project.

Required skills:

  • Excellent written communication skills
  • Good verbal communication skills
  • Effective and productive creative thinking and translating creative ideas into tangible content concept and designs
  • Self-starter based only on the guidance of an objective statement or a statement of a desired outcome
  • Preference for an ability to sketch visual storyboards and visual concepts 

You may also get involved in or be responsible for the following items.

  • It will be important to participate in deployments, system updates, and delivery of client training periodically to keep yourself up to speed and directly aware of the product and the associated learner and user experiences.
  • Capturing client feedback about their training and e-learning experience and planning improvements to future training content.
  • Writing product requirements documents and advocating for new product features (in collaboration with product management).
  • Capturing reference implementations and reference designs
  • Facilitating knowledge transfer between product management, product development, and systems integration teams (internal, external)

Required background:

  • Familiar with designing and deploying industrial factory automation
  • Preference for experience with training/educational content design, production, and/or management of an LMS
  • Preference for familiarity with principles of effective adult education

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

Description

Location:             Waterloo, Ontario              
Experience:        3+ years\' experience
Division:              Clearpath Robotics Research Solutions

About Clearpath Robotics Research Solutions

Clearpath Robotics’ research solutions group is a global leader in unmanned vehicle robotics for research and development, and provides hardware, software, and services to enable self-driving vehicle development, deployment, and operation. Clearpath Robotics works with over 500 of the world’s most innovative brands in over 40 countries, serving markets that span mining, military, agriculture, aerospace, and academia. Visit Clearpath Robotics at www.clearpathrobotics.com.

About the Job 

Clearpath Robotics’ Research Systems team is looking for a well organized, relationship-oriented Sales Solutions Engineer with proven skills across all account functions: business development, direct technical sales, and account management.

As our newest Sales Solutions Engineer, your primary responsibilities will be:

  • Review client projects and applications, and assist in the scoping & configuration of application-appropriate robotic solutions for customers, independently and in collaboration with our team of Engineers 
  • Gains customer acceptance by explaining or demonstrating product features and software
  • Submits orders by conferring with technical support staff and costing engineering changes.
  • Provide company, product, and technical overview presentations
  • Provide pre-sales quotes to customers in a timely manner
  • Check purchase orders for accuracy against the quote or standards before processing Provide technical assistance to the customers - answering technical queries and perform research when answers are not immediately available

  • Maintain and develop a high level of knowledge of new technology and the company’s solution offerings
  • Contributes to sales engineering effectiveness by identifying short-term and long-range issues that must be addressed, 

About You

Our next Sales Solutions Engineer is a sharp, articulate and collaborative person, who is 100% comfortable spending their days talking to everyone from grad students to CEOs to rocket scientists. You dream of being part of a close-knit sales team that attacks new challenges with a bear hug and thrives equally on collaboration and friendly competition.

You have an innate drive to be successful, and you bring both the acumen and the grit to achieve your objectives.

Our ideal candidate is someone who is described by friends as:

  • Entrepreneurial and resourceful
  • A confident and articulate speaker with the ability to think on their feet
  • Excellent written communication skills
  • Able to understand and communicate technical concepts
  • Exceptional organization and attention to detail
  • Dynamic, dependable and diligent
  • Highly motivated and self-starting

Required Skills and Experience:

Division:          OTTO Motors

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)
OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses.
