item.title: Data Scientist
item.description:
Description

 

Our team and what we\'ll accomplish together

 

The Marketing, Strategy and Data Insights team supports TELUS Future Friendly Home (FFH) by unlocking the power of data and producing deep analytics to deliver actionable insights and generate value for our business and our customers. We are looking for someone passionate about data and new technologies to join our data science group and be a key player in our Machine Learning and AI journey. Always wanted to work with a team of innovators and be part of a culture that embraces creativity and collaboration? If so, we’d love to talk with you!

 

You’ll collaborate with teams across the company, seeking out innovative data sources such as speech analytics to help identify new business opportunities while championing data driven decision making and the accelerated adoption of AI. You will work closely with our marketing primes on the end to end journey, from ideation session for identification of use cases, to insights activation and monitoring of outcome.

 

As a Data Scientist on the team, you will leverage your expert knowledge of data science to automate and facilitate machine learning model development, training and deployment. The team takes pride in the Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning models and solutions they develop and deploy, and take ownership of each step of the process. From hypothesis generation, initial exploration of datasets, development of novel AI techniques, to automation of pipelines and ML models; be a leader in our cloud migration journey.

 

What you\'ll do

 

  • Lead the iterative development, validation, and deployment of AI/ML models
  • Collaborate on end-to-end automation efforts required to bring models to production
  • Work with structured and unstructured raw data to design and develop innovative predictive models, metrics, and dashboards to uncover actionable insights
  • Visualize and report data findings creatively in a variety of visual formats that provide insights to the organization
  • Influence how we approach business challenges and opportunities by driving the adoption of a data-driven mindset
  • Develop re-usable code aimed at delivering on future goals faster and more reliably
  • Build and maintain a strong engagement with key stakeholders to understand business needs and priorities

 

 

Qualifications

 

What you bring

 

  • You are recognized for addressing business needs via your application of data mining and analysis, predictive modeling, statistics and other advanced analytical techniques in which you have previous hands-on work experience
  • You are sought out for your skills in Machine Learning and AI, including classification, clustering, time series analysis, NLP, predictive models and bring 3 or more years of hands-on work and practical business experience in the above areas
  • You are a master communicator capable of breaking down technical and complex concepts in a way that is understood by non-technical audiences
  • You have solid development experience with Python and you are comfortable using various data science libraries such as Scikit-learn, Pandas, Numpy as well as frameworks like TensorFlow, and have applied these skills towards solving actual business matters
  • You possess advanced knowledge in SQL and Apache Spark
  • You are familiar with at least one of the cloud computing platforms - GCP, AWS, Azure
  • You are agile and have a bias for action, removing roadblocks to get results fast

 

Great-to-haves

 

  • Masters or PhD degree in a quantitative field such as Math, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, or Data Science
  • GCP or other cloud certifications #LI-REMOTE

item.title: Design Specialist II
item.description:
Join our team and what we’ll accomplish together

 

The wireless engineering team is a group of highly motivated and talented RF Designers who have a passion for deploying the network infrastructure to achieve best in class network services to our customers. We are the team that engineer our 5G national RAN network.

The team is always at the cutting edge of wireless technology delivering the newest and the best services to our customers. With the advent of 5G, you will have the opportunity to work with peer RF Designers to design the network while leveraging your automation, data science, and machine learning skills.

TELUS is searching for a Designer with extensive experience in RF Design, strong business acumen and leadership skills. As a Senior RF Designer, you will collaborate closely with the client-facing business units offering solutions to future & existing customers in a variety of business different verticals. Your leadership and creativity will serve to understand the customer’s challenges and to design a technical solution that surpasses their expectations by leveraging all that 5G has to offer.

 

What you’ll do 

 

  • Using RF propagation modelling, you will develop novel techniques to simulate wireless coverage supporting the evolution of our networks (5G and IoT)
  • Collaborating with internal teams like Technology Strategy and Product Development to understand new technologies and services to prepare our team to succeed in an evolving business environment
  • Leveraging data analytics to define future network deployment strategy in a variety of business verticals.
  • Developing dashboards and data visualizations you will provide insight into network performance that can be shared with executives, peer groups and tools that are implemented in customer portals 
  • Keeping up-to-date with software, data science, and RF technologies while proposing new ideas for platforms and tools

 

 

What you bring

 

  • Bachelor degree in Engineering ( Electrical or Computer) 
  • Advanced presentation & communication skills. The successful candidate will be called upon to present highly technical material in an easily digestible manner at all levels of the organization and to potential customers
  • Commended for your inter-personal skills, critical thinking, analytical, and problem solving skills
  • A minimum of 10-year minimum experience in an RF engineering team, with a deep insight of industry standard propagation tools (ex. Planet, ATOLL) 
  • Experience in designing macro sites, small cells & and in-building coverage solutions
  • A sound knowledge of 3GPP (5G/LTE/UMTS/HSPA) radio access network design, optimization and capacity engineering
  • A strong understanding of databases and big data including MySQL, NoSQL databases, SPLUNK, Python and Alteryx
  • Passionate about automation, data science, and machine learning

 

Great-to-haves

 

  • Master degree in Engineering or Computer Science
  • MBA or similar business training certifications
  • Knowledge of Tableau, Splunk or Alteryx

item.title: Senior Data Engineering Consultant, TELUS Business Solutions Marketing Analytics
item.description:
Description

 

Join our team 

 

Our Team – TELUS Business Solutions Marketing Analytics - has a mandate to build solutions for our stakeholders using data to drive business outcomes. We love to turn data into stories - stories about money falling through the cracks, success stories about our products and services, but most importantly stories about our customers and how we can enhance their experience.

Come join our team if you have a passion for data, analytics, and marketing, the courage to innovate, embrace change and embody spirited teamwork to support stakeholders across a wide variety of teams.

 

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together 

 

As a Senior Data Engineering Consultant in the team, you will be working with Business Stakeholders and the Data Scientists to build data assets that will be leveraged by the data scientists for machine learning/AI models to protect the customer base, acquire new customers and to enable intelligent marketing campaigns. Your solutions will have a direct impact on marketing sales targets and P&L.

 

Here\'s how

 

  • Design and build scalable and resilient Data & Analytics solutions in Google Cloud Platform – architect technical solutions to obtain, process, store and provide insights based on processed data
  • Build data assets for machine learning purposes on Google Cloud Platform 
  • Work on automation and optimization of internal processes
  • Provide data analysis and standard reporting support 
  • Design, develop, and review data architecture, model, flow, and integration – be hands on and involved with every stage of the ETL pipeline
  • Keep up to date with the evolving Cloud technology and Big Data technology, share the knowledge across the organization by enabling best practices, standards, governed processes and relevant technologies

 

 

Qualifications

 

What you bring

 

  • Bachelors and/or Master’s degree preferred
  • 5 years of experience in big data analytics and distributed systems
  • Experience in writing code/ETL processes/Monitoring processes in a production ready environment
  • Knowledge of Big Data with a focus on data engineering; optimizing data, pipelines, ETLs
  • Experience implementing production level deployments at an enterprise scale on Google Cloud Platform
  • Strong coding and development skills in programming languages (e.g. Python, PySpark etc.)
  • A Strong understanding of data structures, databases, data lakes, and data ingestion and transformation routines

 

Great-to-haves

 

  • Google Cloud Platform Experience
  • Post graduate education in Data, Advanced Analytics, Computer Science Eng/Programming or any other relevant program
  • Machine Learning and AI, including classification, clustering, time series analysis, NLP, optimization, and deep learning experience or knowledge
  • Telecom industry experience 
  • B2B Experience


#LI-REMOTE

item.title: Data Scientist - Data Operations and Analytics
item.description:
Let the data do the talking! If you love a challenge and love Data, this role is for you.

 

Our team and what we’ll accomplish together

The Data Operations and Analytics team is an internally focused reporting and analytics product minded team within TELUS, responsible for reporting on key operational metrics to ensure we are delivering to our customers. We discover key insights into our outages and provide the day to day on our ability to deliver. The Reliability Center of Excellence mission is to aim for the highest degree of service reliability for our customers – and for our team. We are dedicated to support all aspects of improving reliability here within TELUS operations. Our team includes a passionate group of business analysts, network analysts, data analysts, data scientists and data engineers.

 

The Data Operations and Analytics team is looking for Data Scientists to play a key role in unlocking and driving outcomes for the Reliability Center of Excellence organization. This includes reporting results, uncovering insights, and developing AI/ML products that will enable our team to deliver on our Reliability promise.

 

As a Data Scientist on the team, you will collaborate with teams across the company, understanding the various areas within operations, seeking out new opportunities perfect for machine learning. Combining your expertise of data science with your strong software development skills, you will automate and facilitate data exploration, analytics, model development, training and deployment. 

 

Candidates for the role will be passionately curious to understand the ‘why’ behind the data and excited for the opportunity to play an integral role in steering a new data science team into maturity.

 

What you’ll do

 

 

  • Use data to tell the story of our operations and discover opportunities to improve our practices and enhance our decision-support ability
  • Explore raw data to design and develop innovative predictive models, metrics, and dashboards to uncover actionable insights
  • Lead the iterative development, validation, and deployment of AI/ML models
  • Manage end-to-end automation efforts required to bring models to production
  • Develop re-usable code aimed at delivering on future goals faster and more reliably
  • Build and maintain a strong engagement with key stakeholders to understand business needs and priorities
  • Be an integral resource in the development and maturity of the data strategy within Data Operations and Analytics 

What you bring

 

  • A passion for how data can be used to uncover new insights, solve unique problems and drive effective actions
  • Be a strategic thinker and a bias for action and crafting and driving change
  • Be curious and creative in looking at metrics to identify and testing new critical metrics for the team
  • Have strong presentation skills with the ability to tell stories with data and master visualizations and be able to explain complex topics to non-technical audiences
  • You thrive in an environment where no playbook or rulebook exists, you will find a way through unforeseen challenges to obtain your goal
  • You value deploying the correct Machine Learning and AI solution for the task instead of relying on heavy computational neural networks
  • You are passionate about the learning new AI/ML techniques outside of your existing toolbox but has in-depth experience in one of the following: Linear Regression, Binary & Multiclass Logistic Regressions, K-means Clustering, Random Forests, Time Series Forecast, Matrix Factorization, LightBGM, Boosted Tree & XGBoost.
  • You have experience in NLP feature engineering and modeling (e.g., text classification, entity recognition, dependency parsing), NLU and Natural Language Inference.
  • You have mastered SQL and you develop in Python regularly and work with Pandas, Scikit-learn, and Numpy. You also have familiarity with Tensorflow.
  • You are a strong software developer and have experience with GitHub, and AI development lifecycles, including MLOps (CI/CD/CT)
  • You possess working knowledge of distributed computing and GPU computing and are familiar with at least one of the cloud computing platforms - GCP, AWS, Azure
  • Minimum of 3+ years of working with large data sets and analyzing data to identify patterns and in Writing and testing code proficiently 


Great to haves

 

  • Google Cloud Platform and tools knowledge 
  • Bachelor degree in Computer Science or Engineering or equivalent, or equivalent education and/or experience

item.title: Lead Data Engineer
item.description:
Description


 

Join our team and what we\'ll accomplish together


We are looking for an enthusiastic Lead Data Engineer who can help us bring focus, flow, and joy to all developers at TELUS as part of our Platform Engineering team.
 
We believe that a strong data science competency is required at TELUS for our business to be successful, and that happy humans build fantastic software. And so our calling is to improve developer focus, flow, and joy at TELUS. This means implementing changes to our systems and processes to make developer platform insights into reality.
 
 

What you will do
 

  • Lead a team of data engineers, data analysts and developers on our journey to strengthen the developer experience through all data ingested, secured, managed, processed and analyzed on our metrics platform
  • Lead initiatives that will improve focus, flow, and joy for software developers across the organization
     
  • Work with equally smart, grounded and collaborative individuals, as well as down-to-earth leaders who get stuff done and deliver measurable results
  • Lead challenging and interesting problems, and strive to do the right thing, the right way and continuously improve via KPIs
  • Innovate every day and have the freedom to contribute your ideas
  • Drive the development of data analytics strategy by developing and enhancing data democratization principles
  • Present our users with relevant, actionable and timely data to improve on software development KPIs such as stability, velocity and availability

 

The platform engineering team is delivering data analytics capabilities built upon unified scalable platforms, advanced AI tooling, high quality data,

 

We are entrepreneurial and passionate, we believe that anything is possible and can be achieved by innovative and meaningful outcomes for our customers, team members and that through meaningful and impactful endeavors we can integrate dynamic change in our professional lives.

 

We intend to shape the future of how machine learning, data processing and analysis can drive TELUS through insights that solve releasing software to production on-demand.

 

Help architect the future of our enterprise data solutions and leverage the best of Google Cloud’s data management, analysis and machine learning capabilities and drive forward our data strategy.

 

Here’s how

 

  • Overseeing the team that builds and iterates data pipelines to process data either where it lives, or across boundaries into a single system. 
  • Analyze datasets, build data relationships and models to generate reports, meaningful insights and machine learning automation to support the business
  • Build a cohesive data platform that extends between the cloud and our data centers which can ingest, transform and process data.
  • Support operational efficiencies across our people, software engineering processes, management and our technical programs by leveraging data retrieved from our systems and tools.
  • Lead the team supporting the data pipelines feeding into our machine learning algorithms and models. Explore the latest tools and API’s that can help optimize our Machine Learning operations.
  • Lead the team to assist the extracting, loading, transforming, cleaning, and validating of data from both inside and outside of Telus.

Qualifications


 

What you bring

 

  • You are recognized for your 5+ years of experience of IT platform implementation in a technical capacity
     
  • You are sought out for your 5+ years experience of Data Lake and platforms implementation with experience implementing and performance tuning 
  • Realize the vision of Data Democratization for software delivery metrics. Educate our customers on how to work with data to improve and reap the rewards
  • AI/ML tools expertise
  • GCP Professional Data Engineering certification
  • Google Cloud Dataflow and Google BigQuery experience
  • Orchestration and job scheduling platforms experience
  • Experience working with Google Cloud data products (CloudSQL, Spanner, Cloud Storage, Pub/Sub, Dataflow, Dataproc, Bigtable, BigQuery, DataLooker, Dataprep, Composer, etc)
  • You are respected for your experience in designing and deploying distributed, multi-technology, data processing systems
  • You bring systems design experience with the ability to architect and explain complex systems interactions, data flows, common interfaces and APIs
  • You bring a deep understanding of and experience with software development and programming languages and Python, Perl and Shell scripting
  • Communication skills to ensure effective management of relationships, prepare presentations for leadership consumption.

item.title: Data Scientist
item.description:
Description

 

JOIN OUR TEAM

 

Join the Procurement Analytics Center of Excellence (PACE), TELUS and support our mission to transform the chief procurement office (CPO) to a fully digital organization where data is at the heart of every decision we make. Enable stakeholders to efficiently evolve and consume actionable insights through transformation strategy.

 

We are an advanced data and AI team thriving on solving business problems and supporting procurement decisions using the power of data, advanced analytics, and reliable software. We provide end to end support from strategy and development to deployment and monitoring of all assets, including machine learning model, Tableau dashboards and data engineering ETLs using cutting edge Cloud technologies (e.g., Google BigQuery and GCP AI Platform), open source tools (e.g., Python, Sklearn, NLTK, Tensorflow), and enterprise products (e.g., Tableau, GitHub, Terraform).

 

In achieving our goal to enable data-driven decision making in CPO, PACE team is looking for an experienced data scientist who is able to regularly engage and interact with our business stakeholders to identify opportunities and develop complete solutions to turn data into insight for decision making.

 

What you’ll do:

 

As an experienced Data Scientist in PACE’s Insight Generation group, you will be at the front end, systematically analyzing and transforming vast amounts of tabular and unstructured data into actionable insights that are impactful in several ways to enable the organization to achieve their goals. We expect you to go above and beyond your role in working with like-minded, entrepreneurial colleagues to strengthen our data driven decision-making culture, improve the customer experience leading to revenue growth, cost reduction, and improved efficiency. You will be responsible to:

 

  • Work closely with business stakeholders to learn about data issues and insight gaps and take action to fill the gap
  • Work with the ‘Insight Generation ’ group within PACE and develop strategy for reporting, storytelling, and insight generation
  • Proactively looking at opportunities to blend data from across different enterprise systems to generate actionable insights that drive business value
  • Leverage innovative technologies and rigorous methods to extract, analyze, evaluate and interpret complex, multi-dimensional and constantly changing data
  • Question the status-quo and old processes, challenge assumptions, and advocate for AI and data-driven decision making across the chief procurement office
  • Influence PACE strategy and priorities while collaborating with other PACE team members to enable, design, develop, and deploy both data and visualization solutions
  • Mentor and coach other peers at PACE and upskill stakeholders to adopt and utilize reports, dashboards, and insights to inform day-to-day decision making
  • Provide technical coaching and mentoring to team members to ensure appropriate accessing, managing and interpretation of data

 

Qualifications

 

Who you are:

 

  • Hold PhD or master with major in data science, computer science, or applied mathematics (or related quantitative disciplines)
  • Minimum 5 years of experience with Tableau
  • Minimum 7 years of experience with SQL
  • Minimum 5 years of experience with Python for data science
  • Minimum 5 years of experience using data extraction and processing technologies to build advanced predictive models.
  • Prior experience with Agile and Jira
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills
  • Ability to communicate data insight to business to various seniority levels of stakeholders
  • Team player

 

Great-to-have:

 

  • Knowledge and experience with Google Cloud Platform (GCP), including Google BigQuery and AI Notebook
  • Knowledge and experience with SAP S4 HANA, SAP ECC is a big asset
  • Familiar with software development methodologies and best practices
  • Experience in Natural Language Processing in Python
  • Experience in ML model production deployment and monitoring

item.title: Design Specialist II - Radio Access Network (RAN) Performance & Optimization Engineer
item.description:
Join our team and what we’ll accomplish together

 

As a member of TELUS’ wireless performance engineering team, you\'ll be responsible for optimizing the Radio Access Network (RAN), and finding new angles/methods to improve network performance, efficiently. You\'ll join the larger Wireless Networks & Services DevOps team that provides TELUS customers with the most reliable network and the best user experience, as we ready ourselves for an exciting and new 5G network. In this team, you\'ll ensure our customers\' wireless experience continuously improves. Your "think outside of the box" and innovation mentality will help shape our key performance indicators (KPIs) which we use to govern our customers\' wireless experience.


What you’ll do 

 

  • You\'ll be responsible for the wireless network performance in Western Canada
  • You’ll be optimizing our RAN as we upgrade the infrastructure through band additions and 5G deployments
  • You’ll ensure network performance KPIs are meeting our targets, and are continuously improving
  • You’ll troubleshoot network degradations, determine root causes, and look for ways to prevent or reduce the impact to our customers
  • You’ll support network upgrades by analyzing the impacts on performance, and proposing optimizations to enrich the overall customer experience
  • You’ll aid our client support teams for escalated issues that may require network engineering to resolve
  • You’ll be exposed to the latest wireless technology innovation planned for TELUS, and be ready to support their launch from a performance management perspective

What you bring 

 

  • With 10+ years of relevant professional experience
  • Recognized for your excellent knowledge of LTE and NR radio access network performance and optimization: parameter/feature optimization, signaling analysis, mobility management, traffic balancing, and self-optimizing network (SON) features
  • Respected for your RAN equipment knowledge (at least two of Huawei/Nokia/Samsung): parameters, capabilities and limitations of the hardware and software portfolio
  • Regarded for your wireless core network knowledge (VoLTE, EPC, IMS) and 5G technology roadmap
  • Acknowledged for your proficiency with the OSS (at least two of Huawei U2000 / Nokia NetAct / Samsung USM), call trace tools (ActixOne, Netscout)
  • Skilled in data science: data manipulation, statistical analysis, machine learning and automation
  • Confident with SQL, SPLUNK, Python (or other scripting languages)
  • With a Bachelor degree in Engineering or related studies

 
Great-to-haves
 

  • Passion, initiative, and a continuous improvement and learning mindset 
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills, and strong presentation skills
  • Strong collaboration, teamwork and networking skills

item.title: Data Scientist
item.description:
Join our team


Our Reliability Centre of Excellence team ensures that Reliability by Design is embedded within our network and services architecture and operations while maintaining a reliability-focused culture across TELUS.

Transparently, the environment is fast paced, intense, and demanding. There are no proven solutions to leverage, a steep learning curve, and continuous expectations from executive leadership to drive value for customers.  On the other hand, you will be working on a project that has C-suite visibility, an opportunity to redefine technology possibilities and capabilities, and transform the customer experience at TELUS.  
 

Here\'s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

As a Data Scientist, you will be at the front end, systematically analyzing and transforming vast amounts of unstructured data into actionable insights that are impactful in many ways.  The expectation is to go above and beyond your role in working with like-minded, entrepreneurial colleagues to strengthen our data driven decision-making culture, improve the customer experience, increase revenue, reduce operating costs, and drive growth.
 

How do you know this is the right challenge for you?  Quite simply, you are known as someone who:
 

  • has a history of driving insights that have a profound impact on the business or customers
  • is resilient and can lead others through high pressure, ambiguous and challenging environments
  • has the “know how” in leveraging rigorous and structured approach to solve complex problems


Here\'s How

Intrinsically, you are:
 

  • Entrepreneurial:  embrace the art of the possible and take initiative in driving change
  • Strong communicator:  tell the story and get to the point in a clear and concise manner
  • Curious and inquisitive:  are passionate about learning and continuously drill down into a problem to uncover the root cause
  • Courageous:  are prepared to go to a place of discomfort and thrive in ambiguity
  • Inclusive:  collaborate with multidisciplinary teams and individuals with diverse backgrounds, and value different perspectives
  • Technology advocate: leverage tools and capabilities to drive insights and efficiencies
  • Action oriented: turn strategic visions into solution designs and execution plans
  • Customer-centric:  always look through the lens of the customer
     

Additional factors that make you a great member to our team

 

  • 5+ years of experience in evaluating and applying statistical and predictive models (i.e. SPSS) including constructing algorithms, regressions, and clustering
  • Advanced proficiency in database querying, data extraction frameworks, data mining, machine learning, artificial intelligence and relational database design
  • Fluency in programming languages: SQL, R, Python, Java, SASS.
  • Data visualization experience with platforms such as Tableau
  • Degree in science, math, engineering, computer science, or other technology related discipline

item.title: Design Specialist II - RAN Development
item.description:
Join our team and what we’ll accomplish together

 

This is an opportunity to join a highly technical, dynamic team during a transformational journey. The RAN Development & New Service Introduction team is a group of highly motivated engineers who have a passion for developing and implementing new technologies to support our customers increasing demand for wireless service.

You will have the opportunity not only to influence the introduction of new technologies and leverage your expertise of modern engineering best practices, including automation and machine learning but also to build a wireless network that delivers continued award-winning customer experiences.

 

What you’ll do 

 

  • Responsible for LTE and 5G RAN network hardware, software, and feature new technology introduction
  • Proactively Communicate/clarify TELUS requirements to vendors and evaluates responses
  • Translate LTE/5G technical aspects into business impact and vice versa, plus E2E integration requirement 
  • Propose solutions and features optimization engineering guidelines, provide support for field teams
  • Plan the execution of the TELUS strategy and get involved in the execution 
  • Validate vendor compliance to industry/TELUS standards and the functional and performance requirements by conducting lab proof of concept and interoperability testing with other systems, etc
  • Communicate and present cross-team to explain the technical decisions and their outcomes
  • Apply a ‘Reliability by design’ approach during the new technology planning and rollout steps

What you bring

 

Solid knowledge of LTE/5G RF design and optimization (5+ years’ experience)
Understand future network technology evolution: HeNet (small cell), AI & Machine learning, MEC, 5G Network slicing, and SDN/virtualization, Cloud technology
Familiar with 3GPP spec., including air interface implementation, RRM, MM, and RF compliance
Understand basic knowledge of IP, Video streaming, Multicast, and other networking protocols
Hands-on experience with the network/performance testing tools such as IXIA, SmartBits, Chariot, QXDM, Agilent drive testing tool, XCAL, TEMS, and Actix tool IP based application knowledge and exposure to network security would also be assets
5 or more years performing lab testing evaluations including and not limited to proof of concept. Experience in writing test plans for different scenarios, collecting requirements from users
Ability to provide on-demand, specialized technical advice for the technical solution of several wide-ranging problems and to interact with others including on a proactive customer-focused basis
Familiar with wireless network troubleshooting procedure and performance enhancement process with knowledge related
 

Great-to-haves

 

Master degree in telecom 
P.Eng or Eng designation

item.title: Manager Performance Analysis (Virtual Role - Canada Wide)
item.description:
Description

Join our team 

At TELUS, we’re looking for bright people that like solving big problems. The Wireline Engineering Build and Operate (WEBO) team manages wireline network deployment and field operation while being an engine of efficiency and innovation within the Customer Technology Excellence (CTE) organization. We are looking for a dynamic and innovative Performance Analysis Manager with a knack for challenging the status quo to join our Strategy, Transformation & Enablement (STE) team. The successful candidate will focus on identifying and initiating strategic initiatives that take organizational costs out, help win new customers over, and improve our network reliability. Additionally, the successful candidate will lead the development of systems needed to support our business and actively monitor the performance of WEBO across a multitude of operational and financial metrics.

Here’s what we believe:

 

  • We break down silos - by bringing together multiple business units for great outcomes 
  • We challenge the status quo – and when others think we’re done, we make it better
  • We live up to our commitments – to ourselves, our friends, family, peers, leaders and our customers 
  • Our success is all about how we do things – how we think, solve problems, deliver, communicate, and more

 
Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

As the Performance Analysis Manager within the STE Team you will utilize your exceptional leadership skills and analytical knowledge to guide your team to uncover and pitch transformation and improvement opportunities to the leadership team. You’ll leverage your operational and financial knowledge to monitor existing KPIs and recommend how they should evolve to optimize the performance of the business. You’ll also work with a broad stakeholder group to evolve and implement systems that compliment our processes. You will have to use your critical thinking and your excellent storytelling ability to bring key stakeholders on board to help realize the opportunities you uncover and support you as you evolve our systems. Finally you’ll keep up with the latest digital technologies available to our team spearheading the integration of Machine Learning / Artificial intelligence within WEBO’s processes.

Here’s how you’ll do it:

 

  • Guide the evolution of the data infrastructure WEBO utilizes and transform the data we collect into actionable insights through ad-hoc and regular reporting and by pitching opportunities uncovered in the data
  • comb through the data we collect and identify new data we should be collecting to unlock new transformation and improvement opportunities and empower existing ones
  • Manage WEBO’s scorecard and monitor additional performance indicators on an ongoing basis looking out for the operational and financial performance of our business
  • Support the development of systems that compliment the process 1200 WEBO team members utilize with an initial focus on dispatch and resource planning
  • Identify and deliver on a portfolio of digital projects to improve operational processes and customer experience
  • Spearhead the integration of Machine Learning / Artificial Intelligence within our operations 

 

#LI-hybrid #LI-remote

Qualifications

You’re the missing piece of the puzzle if you are:

 

  • A proven leader with the ability to direct, coach and mentor people to be their best selves
  • Motivated and action-oriented, accountable to the business, and adaptable with a positive attitude
  • Data centric with strong problem solving skills including creating business cases and visualizing data to tell compelling stories
  • Proactive strategist who can balance competing priorities optimizing for the great good of TELUS / WEBO
  • Big picture thinker who anticipates trends/issues and assembles resources to effectively respond
  • An innovator who isn’t afraid to explore new ways of thinking and new technologies to achieve business objectives
  • Able to understand CAPEX and OPEX budgets and how various aspects of operations affect financial performance
  • Have experience with systems development including directing onshore and offshore resources as well as contractors
  • Demonstrated ability to drive results through coordination of multiple initiatives, removal of obstacles while navigating environment of rapid change
  • Have a University degree, post-secondary education or equivalent business experience

 
Great-to-haves

 

  • 5+ years of management experience
  • Process Improvement experience and certification (Green/Black Belt)
  • Ability to query data and write logic / algorithms
  • Previous accounting or finance experience
  • Google Cloud Platform experience especially with Big Query, Vertex AI or Workflows 
  • Knowledge of SAP and project related reporting within
  • Knowledge of TELUS dispatch systems
  • Strong knowledge of Looker Studio

 

#LI-hybrid #LI-remote

#LI-hybrid #LI-remote

item.title: Data Platform Engineer
item.description:
Description

 

Join our team and what we\'ll accomplish together

 

The Data Platforms team is the hub of analytics at TELUS.  So much so that our future forward solution is known as Data Hub.  Our team architects and operationalizes the underlying infrastructure used to power data solutions that drive value and deliver results from analytics. Our platforms provide the ability to put data into motion through batch and real-time processes to bring data from on-premise systems to cloud platforms. Our cloud presence allows TELUS teams to make use of cloud native functionality to drive reporting and developing machine learning models.  The sky\'s the limit.

 

We are looking for technical enthusiasts who can help build our next generation solution. Together we will build and enable best-in-class data platforms with a focus on expanding and automating our capabilities while ensuring always available analytics in Google’s Cloud Platform.


 
Enable teams across the organization to make better use of data. Use your analytical skills and ability to assess the impact of data on upstream and downstream systems and help clarify and define cloud-related business processes and best practices across TELUS. Help architect the transformation and modernization of our enterprise data solutions and the integration of Google Cloud and native GCP services and 3rd party data technologies.

 

Here’s How

 

  • Work with and listen to business and technical teams to understand their needs
  • Define the ideal data flow and drive process and architecture changes to make it happen by collaborating with their owners
  • Design and implement solutions to move data across systems and locations
  • Collaborate kindly and proactively with the rest of our team and our customers (internal teams at TELUS)
  • Take solutions from concept to production by using 3rd party tools, writing code, config, and scripts
  • Identify opportunities for automation and implement in the development and production process
  • Provision and maintain existing platforms to facilitate growth and stability
  • Author quality documentation for any solutions implemented on both how they were implemented and how to use them
  • Ensure the best practices are followed so that system uptime requirements are met
     

Qualifications

What you bring

 

  • You are kind and want to make things better for others in collaboration with others
  • You have hands-on experience with cloud-native technologies, such as Terraform
  • You can design and deploy distributed, multi-technology, data processing systems
  • You have used cloud platforms such as Google Cloud for application hosting
  • You have a 4+ years of experience in System Operations or Software Development 
  • You have experience using YAML and/or JSON for configuration
  • You can explain complex systems interactions, data flows, common interfaces, and APIs
  • You understand that system stability drives availability and customer trust
  • You are able to provision infrastructure and secure & reliable services and applications in the cloud
  • You are able to provide guidance to optimize data collection, storage, and consumption by choosing the right platforms and tools for the right use cases
  • You have experience deploying to and maintaining production environments
  • You don’t deploy to production on Fridays

 

Great-to-haves

 

 

  • Hands-on familiarity with at least one of: Kafka, Google Cloud Platform, NiFi
  • Comfortable with scripting languages
  • Understanding of DevOps, DataOps principles and tools
  • Data Warehousing design experience
  • Familiarity with monitoring, alerts, and logging solutions

item.title: Data Ethicist - REMOTE
item.description:
Description


Join our team and what we\'ll accomplish together


The TELUS Data & Trust Office provides world-class, innovative privacy solutions to TELUS. We partner with teams across the organization to advance our corporate priorities, support innovation and ultimately deliver on our promise to safeguard our customers\' privacy and to earn and maintain their trust. As the Data Ethicist, reporting to the Director of Data Ethics & Governance, you will provide thought-leadership and work with a cross-functional group focused on enabling a framework for responsible use of data, including health data. You will guide the design and development of data research, data-driven products and services in accordance with ethical principles. 


You will be a champion for data ethics across the organization and you will advocate for TELUS’ Trust Model as the fundamental driver for all of our decisions around data, recognizing how critical customer and team member trust is to TELUS’ mission. Your commitment to data ethics will support our business needs as well as our position on social capitalism as we seek opportunities to innovate with data, including health data, for social good and specifically to address some of society’s most pressing problems.


Here’s how

 

  • Provide ethical analysis and questioning for the implications of data use and technology evolution that is fair and transparent, considering the experience of a broad range of stakeholders to identify potential unintended consequences and impacts 
  • Establish the data ethics framework to ensure there is understanding, consideration and foresight into the issues raised by previously unimaginable uses of data and the development of emerging technologies like AI
  • Enhance understanding of data ethics and its importance across TELUS, providing education and influencing the data user community and network of Data Stewards on responsible innovation
  • Work with TELUS engineers, researchers, designers and business stakeholders to embed ethical decision-making and risk mitigation and monitoring processes into emerging technology, ensuring that design and production is fit for purpose and beneficial
  • Maintain expert knowledge of data ethics toolkits, best practices and contribute to industry working groups on standards for data ethics and responsible innovation.
  • Define and oversee stakeholder engagement methods to incorporate participatory human-centered design and the consultation of diverse voices across the innovation lifecycle to enhance public understanding and improve the social impacts of technology
  • Learn continuously, innovate every day and seek opportunities to develop and demonstrate thought leadership with external stakeholders

 

 

Qualifications

 

What you bring

 

  • University degree or equivalent experience in applied ethics, philosophy, ethical machine learning, human-computer interaction, social and human sciences, or relevant fields
  • Valued for your knowledge and expertise in data ethics and ethical risk assessments of emerging technology
  • Experienced in establishing ethical decision-making and monitoring processes
  • Demonstrated knowledge and experience in conducting analysis around societal expectations, including identifying stakeholder values and defining techniques for engagement and input
  • Highly adaptable and comfortable working in a nascent field in a demanding and fast-paced environment
  • Able to identify and proactively consider opportunities outside of conventional thinking, providing multiple solutions to resolve problems and address gaps
  • Effective in written communication and verbally communicating progress on initiatives in leadership forums
  • Trusted as a collaborative partner with excellent interpersonal skills who will act with integrity and exemplify ethical practices to fulfill TELUS’ commitments to its customers
  • Post-secondary degree is a requirement


Great-to-haves

 

  • Bilingualism in English & French, verbal and/or written
  • Experience working in a large, matrixed organization
  • Experienced in implementing multidisciplinary data ethics practices and collaborating in a cross-functional environment working with technology, policy, engineering, product and research teams

item.title: Director - Wireless Access Network Performance and Operations
item.description:
If technologies such as IoT, M2M, Edge Computing, 5G Network Services, connected cars, drones, augmented reality and virtual reality – to name a few- are your passion, this is definitely for you.

 
Join our team and what we’ll accomplish together 


As Director, Wireless Access Network Performance and Operations, you will work with a world class team to optimize, operate and maintain our wireless access network, i.e. lead global Radio Access Network (RAN) performance, optimization and operation to maintain TELUS brand technology leadership in Canada and the world while ensuring the best wireless experience for our customers. 
With the increasing complexity of radio systems and the advent of new wireless technologies, you will have the opportunity not only to influence the introduction of new technologies and leverage your expertise of modern engineering best practices, including automation and machine learning, but also build and maintain a wireless network that delivers continued award-winning customer experiences.
Reporting to the Vice-president of Wireless Strategy and 5G Services, you’ll be an important part of the leadership team, working together to drive our overall strategy, lead in implementing cutting edge wireless technologies and grow our network reputation and brand.
A proven high-performer, you thrive at working in a fluid, dynamic and flexible environment that values human-centric leadership.


Here’s how

 

 

  • Develop, evolve and oversee the optimization and reliable operation of wireless access networks, tactics, transformations and metrics that enhance team engagement, enable advocacy and attract talent
  • Deliver best in class wireless customer experience including exceptional voice, video and business services as well as reliable network connectivity at home, at work and on the go 
  • Maintain network integrity, quality and reliability throughout future technology evolution 
  • Build strong working relationships, establish trust and proactively advise executives, senior leaders and other stakeholder to drive the success of Wireless Access Technology development and TELUS’ strategies and priority programs
  • Build and present simplified messages to TELUS executives in both technical and business teams 
  • Support CAPEX and OPEX budget planning by working with Capital Management team and other stakeholders, and ensure execution alignment with plan

 

What you bring

 

  • A proven leader with the ability to direct, coach and mentor people to be their best selves
  • A proactive strategist who can balance competing priorities to drive wireless access technology development completion
  • A big picture thinker who anticipates trends/issues and assembles resources to effectively respond
  • A consultant and persuasive communicator who provides superior guidance and direction to the team
  • A strong program leader who can gain consensus and expertly deliver plans in a complex stakeholder environment
  • A keen observer of both internal and external business environment and how it relates to TELUS
  • A proven innovator who isn’t afraid to explore new ways of wireless access technologies to achieve business objectives
  • +10 years of wireless access technology development leadership, including hands-on and management experiences
  • Understand the evolving technology landscape and develop technology that may adequately solve business needs via partner discovery and close collaboration with internal teams and external partners
  • Proven track record on wireless access technology performance and optimization of 3G/4G/5G, including both classic 3GPP RAN and Open RAN
  • An undergraduate degree and/or postgraduate certificate in a related discipline, and extensive related business experience
  • Experience working in a diverse environment
  • Ability to manage CAPEX and OPEX budget
  • Strong and demonstrable large project/process management experience and capability to drive efficiency


Great-to-haves

 

  • MBA or Master’s degree in science or engineering is a great asset
  • International and global operator experience is an asset

 

Location:  Any major Canadian city

item.title: Developer Analyst III
item.description:
Description

 

Our team and what we’ll accomplish together


We have an exciting opportunity for you to join our Business Intelligence (BI) team in Home Solutions Customer Experience (HSCE).


The Business Intelligence (BI) team uses data & analytics to support over 15,000 global team members across a number of internal teams. We use data from over 10 million annual customer interactions to feed our BI & Customer Feedback solutions, and support informed decision making across our Contact Centre and Field operations teams.

 

You will be at the forefront as we work to design and build the next generation BI platform based on the Google Cloud Platform using technologies and tools that will include SQL, Python, BigQuery, Looker, and GitHub. 


What you’ll do


As a Developer Analyst, you will contribute to various initiatives within the overall Home Solutions Customer Experience (HSCE) team, ranging from designing, developing and maintaining business intelligence solutions and documentation. Deploy business intelligence data products into production environments, leveraging best practices with: data monitoring, code reviews, integration testing, and release management. Partner with business primes to get a sense of their business intelligence strategy and propose and implement capabilities that can achieve these outcomes. And as a lover of data, you will enjoy being curious and stay current on top developments in cloud technology and machine learning, and identify opportunities to use these approaches to drive a data centric culture.

 

 

Qualifications

 

What you bring

 

  • Demonstrated ability to analyze source data and document the requirements for BI solutions on Google Cloud Platform
  • Assist with design, implementation, ingestion and curation functions on Google Cloud Platform using GCP native or custom programming
  • Planning and building semantic layer (business logic) capabilities using BigQuery and/or LookML (or equivalent technologies)
  • Database knowledge and experience with utilizing pipelines and data marts across different database platforms
  • Strong concept of dimensional modeling concepts – facts vs. dimensions, surrogate keys, and data granularity
  • Knowledge of SQL including writing, debugging and tuning T-SQL queries, creating SQL tables, views and stored procedures and a strong understanding of relational databases
  • Collaborating and helping fellow team members develop their technical capabilities and also being comfortable with questioning decisions and design
  • Able to articulate and communicate technical approaches and information to a business orientated audience

 

Great-to-haves

 

  • University degree in Computer Science or other quantitative discipline
  • Knowledge of contact center and field delivery operational and performance metrics and process

 

Don’t have everything we think are ‘great-to-haves’? Don’t let that dissuade you! Attitude, motivation and a willingness to learn and collaborate are the most important things we are looking for. If you think you have what it takes, please apply!

item.title: Design Specialist II- Messaging Dev/Ops
item.description:
Join our team and what we’ll accomplish together


Our team objective is to enable and support our rapidly-evolving messaging products and services for our customers in the way that makes sense to them, is easy to understand and to use.

The Messaging DevOps team works closely with cross functional teams across the organization to realize our collective Customer First vision. We learn and grow through our experiences, new technology and process evolution and plan and prepare for the future! As experts in our fields, we’re a team who equally celebrates failure and success. Also, our mandate is also to improve network and service reliability, resiliency, and time to market while further developing our scripting and automation system capabilities for the future.


The Messaging team is seeking a creative, entrepreneurial, energetic, and bright candidate to join our team.


Your mission is to contribute to strategies supporting rollout of our services in 5G and beyond, in NFV / GCP, to contribute to the automation of routine/repetitive activities, to improve existing workflows and network capacity/service quality, to support the team with the real-time monitoring, maintenance, support, operations, including on-call. Last, but not least, to predict failure, initialize self-healing mechanisms and failover, and recommend proactive healing process. This is an opportunity to also shape and guide the next generation of technology professionals with your leadership, knowledge, curiosity and drive to do more for our customers.


What you’ll do 


We’re a dynamic team, so a high degree of flexibility is required to adapt to a wide variety of tasks and
functions.

  • Explore customer feedback and analytics to drive improvements in our products and services and   clearly see things from the perspective of a customer
  • Thrive in a lean, fast paced and changing environment
  • View collaboration as essential to your work
  • Have a passion for reliability
  •  Build, maintain and leverage strong relationships with your stakeholders and maintain a collaborative model in order to ensure that you are collectively meeting the requirements of the business 
  • Create, execute, improve and maintain automation test, provisioning, and workflow scripts through standard methodologies, closely monitor results, and participate in peer reviews
  •  Help drive the evolution of our teams towards a DevOps and Agile culture

What you bring

 

  • Visible champion and spokesperson for change
  • A strong end to end ownership culture mindset towards product and end customer experience
  • A very strong knowledge of Wireless (5G/LTE/HSPA), Fixed Voice (VoIP/NGN/TDM), Messaging (SMS/MMS/VMS) network architectures/call flows, technologies, networking routing, and signaling protocols 
  • Working knowledge of Telecommunication OSS and BSS management network and systems
  • Familiar with CI/CD (Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery), DevOps best practices
  • Experience with testing and provisioning automation tool sets (Sigos, Jenkins, Splunk, Python, Java, Robot Framework, postgres/sql database)
  • Working knowledge of API integration (REST/SOAP), XML, JSON, YAML
  • Hands-on experience in automation application/scripts development in various environments (Linux, Shell, Web, Windows, etc.) 
  • Know how to architect and deploy secure and robust services/applications on private cloud using NFV infrastructure, SDN (Openstack, Openshift, Contrail), GCP
  • A team player with ability to build relationships, influence others and foster ownership within cross-functional teams
  • Capable of tackling ambiguous problems, bringing structure and process to help shape solutions
  • Good written and oral communication skills, including creating and delivering presentations, summarizing technical content for an executive audience
  • 5+ of years of experience as a software developer or network engineering, preferably in a DevOps environment
  • Degree in Engineering or Computer Science 
  •  

Great-to-haves

 

  • Experience in the wireless core network, especially Messaging SMS, MMS, VMS, F5Load-balancers, Firewall
  • Experience in architecting solutions in a cloud environment
  • Experience in public cloud environment (GCP, AWS)
  • Experience with elastic search environment (kibana, grafana)
  • Experience of mobile network and operator-grade networking
  • Experience with KPI dashboards, data visualization and data science and analytics (Splunk, Elk, Tableau, Elastic Stack, Netscout, Database/SQL)
  • Scripting and/or Software Development Experience (Bash, Python, JavaScript)
  • Experience with Linux, server management, virtualization and containerization (Docker, Kubernetes)
  • Master in Computer science or Engineering degree or related field

item.title: Manager, Marketing - Campaign Development
item.description:
Description

 

Ready to create innovative solutions to optimize 1:1 campaigns?

 

The Campaign Development team is part of the Consumer Mobility Campaign Management and Data Science Team. This team’s mandate is to deliver operational excellence through management of 1:1 campaign development while maintaining the highest level of quality standards, personalization and on-time delivery. Through partnership with multiple cross-functional groups, our team leverages our marketing technology platform investments to drive positive business outcomes.

 

What’s in it for me?

 

You will interact with many stakeholders and levels of leadership across the organization, offering a unique opportunity to learn about the diverse product categories across TELUS and blaze a path to accelerate your career. As the manager, you will be supporting a world-class team of email and SMS developers. You will be responsible for continuing to enhance our team culture of empowerment to create an environment of balance and enjoyment of day-to-day work. Focusing on workload capacity prioritization and continuous improvement in the way we work. In addition, the leader of this team will also be responsible for enhancing our marketing technology capabilities and continuously seek ways to optimize how we work.

 

What you will do:

 

  • Enable a learning, coach and support culture to assist in team member development and career growth. You thrive when helping team members achieve their full potential
  • Foster a diverse and inclusive, collaborative environment focusing on delivering high levels of team member engagement and performance
  • Recommend and implement enhancements to: marketing technology platform, process and campaign automation.
  • Develop strong collaborative relationships with a broad range of stakeholders to understand campaign development requests. Facilitating prioritization discussions, where required, to promote team work-life balance
  • Deliver quality service to our customers, team members, partners and outcome sponsors through consistent application of the TELUS value

 

 

Qualifications

 

You’re the missing piece of the puzzle:

 

  • Demonstrable experience in team member coaching and support to foster an environment of cooperation and success
  • A problem-solving mindset in terms of taking abstract questions and issues, can clearly summarize, and articulate actions to overcome
  • Resilience and adept at thinking outside the box, be curious and ask questions
  • An excellent storyteller, experience presenting to small and large audiences at different levels of the organization
  • Experience with: planning, project delivery, and business process transformation
  • Experience in agile product development with balance of technical and business outcomes
  • A proven track record in balancing immediate and long-term priorities, while being flexible and adaptable

 

Great-to-haves:

 

  • Experiences in successfully navigating large, complex companies
  • Experience with Adobe Campaign Suite with focus on marketing automation
  • Solid understanding of mobility industry dynamics

item.title: Cloud Data Architect
item.description:
Description


Join our team and what we\'ll accomplish together

 

The Data Enterprise Data Layer team designs, implements and oversees the GCP analytics platform at TELUS.  Known as the DataHub, our team architects and operationalizes the underlying infrastructure used to power data solutions that drive value and deliver results from analytics. Our platforms provide the organization with modern cloud native services, DataOps methodologies and processes, and a self-serve data environment to test & learn and productionalize data models enabling data driven decisions.  Our vision is to empower our TELUS business partners with a standardized platform utilizing infrastructure, policy and governance as code, setting guide rails for teams to develop their data & analytics use cases within our cloud data platform.

We are looking for technical enthusiasts who can help build our next generation solution.
Together we will build and enable best-in-class data platforms with a focus on expanding our capabilities while ensuring always available analytics in Google’s Cloud Platform.
 
Enable teams across the organization to make better use of data. Use your analytical skills and ability to assess the impact of data on upstream and downstream systems and help clarify and define cloud-related business processes and best practices across TELUS. Help architect the transformation and modernization of our enterprise data solutions and the integration of Google Cloud and native GCP services and 3rd party data technologies.


What you’ll do

 

  • Work with and listen to business and technical teams to understand their needs
  • Define the ideal cloud data architecture with a focus on self-serve, efficiency, security and privacy
  • Design and implement solutions that move us forward on our MLOPs, DevOps and infrastructure as code journey within GCP
  • Collaborate kindly and proactively with the rest of our team and our customers (internal teams at TELUS)
  • Implement best in class cloud architecture to solve business use cases from concept to production
  • Identify opportunities for automation and implement in the development and production process
  • Provision and maintain existing platforms to facilitate growth and stability
  • Author quality documentation for any solutions implemented on both how they were implemented and how to use them

Qualifications


What you bring

 

  • You are collaborative and able to work with various IT and business teams to deliver on outcomes 
  • You are able to share a vision and implement long-term data strategies while providing value early and often along the journey
  • You have in depth knowledge of data architecture both on premise and on GCP, AWS and / or Azure platforms and have demonstrated experience designing and implementing enterprise grade data environments
  • You have experience with cloud-native technologies, such as Terraform, Kubernetes, Composer and serverless computing
  • You have in depth experience with the flow of data between systems, cloud big data environments and tooling with applications such as BigQuery, Dataflow, BigTable, Data Catalog, CloudSQL, Vertex AI, Pub/Sub, Dataprep and Cloud Spanner
  • You can design and deploy distributed, multi-technology, data processing systems
  • You have experience with YAML and/or JSON for configuration
  • You can explain complex systems interactions, data flows, common interfaces, and APIs to senior leaders and business stakeholders
  • You understand that system stability drives availability and customer trust
  • You have demonstrated experience with Secure by Design and Zero Trust data architectures and are able to provision cloud infrastructure with best in class security
  • You have in depth knowledge of PII and privacy compliance and have demonstrated architectural design, system interactions and life cycle management that puts customer safety first
  • You are able to provide guidance to optimize data collection, storage, and consumption by choosing the right platforms and tools for the right use casesYou have good understanding of DevOps & DataOps principles and tools

 

Great-to-haves

 

 

  • Experience with Google’s BigQuery service
  • Experience with MLOPs methodologies and process
  • Data Warehousing and data modeling design experience
  • Experience with FinOps and Cloud platform budget management

item.title: Senior Systems Analyst I - TELUS Health
item.description:
Join our team
 
Our Collaborative Health Product Delivery team is looking for a highly motivated individual to support and develop product delivery & support solutions in our national portfolio. Join us and be part of the Collaborative Health journey to provide better access to health information and enable better health outcomes for Canadians.
 
Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together
 
You will join a high performing team of analysts on a diverse range of projects spanning our country. As part of our team, you bring your expertise in many areas to help with the delivery of Electronic Medical Records systems. You work closely with many stakeholders to ensure efficient delivery and operations. You are proficient with documentation and can resolve highly technical challenges. You have tight collaboration with other teams, delivering and empowering innovative solutions for our customers.


 
Here\'s how

 

  • As part of our team, you will:
  • Work with the EMR system update team to deploy application updates
  • Document and develop technical processes
  • Develop and review code to automate new systems/functions
  • Diagnose and troubleshoot technical issues for hosted EMR systems
  • Work with multiple teams to bring system enhancements to internal teams and end users
     

You\'re the missing piece of the puzzle


 You are:

 

  • Able to work on large, multi-functional complex systems
  • Experienced with building technical documents/reference materials
  • Known for your excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Proficient in investigating, analyzing and solving problems
  • Skilled in managing/coordinating mid-to-large sized projects
  •  An outside the box thinker, the kind of person who will come up with a solution that was not considered

 
You have:

 

  •  A degree in Computer Science or equivalent
  •  Experience with Windows Server Operating systems
  • Knowledge of server scripting languages (Python/Powershell)
  •  Experience of Oracle/Postgres databases
  • Unshakable experience troubleshooting and resolving system issues (performance, integrity, recovery, security etc)

 
Great-to-haves

 

  • Health Industry experience
  • Salesforce User Experience
  • Knowledge of software version control

item.title: Senior Strategy Manager, Data Platforms
item.description:
Description


Join our team and what we\'ll accomplish together

The Enterprise Data Layer team designs, implements and oversees the GCP analytics platform at TELUS.  Known as the DataHub, our team architects and operationalizes the underlying infrastructure used to power data solutions that drive value and deliver results from analytics. Our platforms provide the organization with modern cloud native services, modern BI tools, DataOps methodologies and processes, and a self-serve data environment to test & learn and productionalize data models enabling data driven decisions.  Our vision is to empower our TELUS business partners with a standardized platform utilizing infrastructure, policy and governance as code, setting guide rails for teams to develop their data & analytics use cases within our cloud data platform and BI toolsets.

 

We are looking for enthusiasts who can help build our next generation solutions enabling best-in-class data platforms with a focus on expanding our capabilities while ensuring always available analytics in Google’s Cloud Platform.  You will support digital transformation at TELUS by partnering with teams across the organization to make better use of their data. Use your strong communication, critical thinking and change management experience to assess the impact of transformation on our partner teams, the upstream and downstream systems and help clarify and define cloud-related business processes and best practices across TELUS. 

 

What you’ll do

 

  • Support the establishment of data a shared strategy across the enterprise to enable the business to meet its strategic and financial objectives
  • Support the creation of automated work intake process, prioritization, metrics, process improvements and resource alignment to planned roadmaps
  • Drive a governed approach with increasing maturity around our data & analytics platforms and tools
  • Liaise with our business and IT partners to ensure alignment on roadmaps and strategic initiatives delivering value and supporting a data driven culture
  • Lead annual strategy reviews for the Enterprise Data Platforms team and collaborate with owners in our larger business unit including coordination and material creation
  • Monitor trends, innovation and opportunities in the industry and with our Vendors
  • Support your DataOps team members in delivering the ideal cloud data architecture with a focus on self-serve, efficiency, security and privacy
  • Identify opportunities for automation and implement in the development and production process

  • Author quality documentation and materials to support messaging around new data capabilities, services and analytics tools, roadmaps, customer onboarding to our data platform, roadmaps, change management and alignment across IT teams

Qualifications


What you bring

 

  • 5-7 years of experience in a Management Consulting, Digital agency or Corporate Strategy with a large organization
  • 3-5 years of experience working in Technology

Great-to-haves
